    • Constructor Detail

      • HPTerminalApplication

        public HPTerminalApplication(java.lang.String port,
                             int fontSize,
                             int speed,
                             int sound,
                             int modeANSI,
                             int logger)
        Create the application.
        Parameters:
        port - - the port to open, e.g. "COM1" or "\\.\COM27" under Windows.
        fontSize - - the size of the font, also defines the window dimensions.
        speed - - the line speed, e.g. 9600 baud.
        sound - - 0=false, 1=true, negative: use default from properties.
        modeANSI - - whether the application shall emulate an ANSI or an HP terminal.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Launch the application.
        Parameters:
        args - - the command line arguments.

      • showLineStatus

        private void showLineStatus()
        Show the status of the incoming CTS and DSR lines.

      • showMessage

        private void showMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Shows the given message on the terminal screen.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to display. May be terminated by CL,LF to move cursor to the start of the next line.

      • getPreferences

        public static java.util.prefs.Preferences getPreferences()
        Returns:
        Preferences

      • resetPreferences

        public static void resetPreferences()
        Delete the user preferences so that the application will start with defaults when started the next time.

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initialize the contents of the frame.

      • putByte

        private void putByte(byte b)
        Append one byte to the ring buffer.
        Parameters:
        b - - the byte to append.

      • inputAvailable

        private boolean inputAvailable()
        Test whether there is anything in the ring buffer.
        Returns:
        true if there is data in the buffer.

      • bufferLength

        int bufferLength()
        Returns:
        The currently used ring buffer length.

      • nextByte

        private byte nextByte()
        Return the next byte from the ring buffer. You should test first with inputAvailable() whether there is anything in the buffer.
        Returns:
        The next byte from the ring buffer.

      • pushbackByte

        private void pushbackByte(byte b)
        Push a byte back into the ring buffer to be read by a following nextByte().
        Parameters:
        b - - the value to be placed into the buffer.

      • dumpBuffer

        private void dumpBuffer()
        Dump the current contents of the ring buffer to System.out.

             java.lang.String msg)

        int sendString(java.lang.String s)
        Send the given string to the host.
        Parameters:
        s - - The ASCII character string to be sent.
        Returns:
        The number of characters sent.

      • sendByte

        Send the given byte to the host.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The number of bytes sent.

        int sendBytes(byte[] b)
        Send the given bytes to the host.
        Parameters:
        b - - An array of bytes to be sent.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes sent.

      • saveLog

        void saveLog(java.lang.String fileName)

      • CTRL

        public static byte CTRL(char c)
        Returns the code of the character key pressed with the Control key. The Control key modifies the raw character code by subtracting 64 from it.
        Parameters:
        c - the character code to be modified.
        Returns:
        the character code with the Control key depressed.

      • serialEvent

        public void serialEvent(jssc.SerialPortEvent serialPortEvent)
        Called when new data arrives at the serial port Copies the data to the ring buffer for later processing.
        Specified by:
        serialEvent in interface jssc.SerialPortEventListener
